intro: Isidrogalvia sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flowered isidrogalva, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Isidrogalviaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pale yellow to white petals that are sessile, meaning they lack a distinct petiole. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine, waxy cuticle, which helps reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Isidrogalvia sessiliflora is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
